title._content: ["Thornedale," Oakleigh Thorne house, Millbrook, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Thornedale," Oakleigh Thorne house, Millbrook, New York. Lawn to pond] [1919] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Federal revival house built 1849, with later additions. Landscape: Helen Stafford (Mrs. Oakleigh) Thorne, from 1908. Other: Oakleigh Thorne was W.O.S. Thorne. Today: House extant. On slide (printed): "176 Fulton Street, New York." (Slide manufacturer T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., Inc.) Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16784 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 57
